alert.note: Alert for Ascension; East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:57AM CDT until April 15 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Ascension Parish in southeastern Louisiana... South Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 200 PM CDT. * At 1157 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Livingston, French Settlement, Port Vincent, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson, Watson, Inniswold, Greenwell Spring, Village St. George, Westminster, Merrydale and Gardere. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 156 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 110 in Louisiana near mile marker 2. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
